item.title: A GNN implementation for ASD diagnosys
item.description: For the SoSe 2025 project on Convolutional Graph Neural Networks, I developed a population-based GNN to classify fMRI scans from the ABIDE dataset, achieving slightly better AUC and F1 scores than a comparable CNN model. The results highlight the advantages of a graph-based approach for this task.

item.title: Income Prediction using different Machine Learning approaches
item.description: For the final project in the SoSe25 Machine Learning and Intelligent Data Analysis class, I analyzed different Machine Learning Approaches to solve Kaggle’s Income Prediction Challenge.

item.title: Sarcasm Detection using a combination of LSTM, attention and manual features.
item.description: For the final project in the ANLP W.S. 2024 class, my group IsThisLoss and I developed LSTM and Bi-LSTM models with attention mechanisms and manually extracted linguistic features for sarcasm detection using the SemEval 2022 Task 6 dataset. The models were optimized through Bayesian hyperparameter tuning. Our best models achieved F1 scores of 0.264 and 0.262, highlighting the importance of incorporating external data and linguistic features.
